description: ADHXZ is a method of encryption that uses a 5$	imes$5 grid to encrypt. The encryption is case-insensitive and follows this replacement rule: `a/A=AH, b/B=AA, c/C=XH, d/D=DA, e/E=ZH, f/F=HD, g/G=XA, h/H=DD, i/I=XD, j/J=XD, k/K=DZ, l/L=AX, m/M=ZA, n/N=HZ, o/O=DH, p/P=AZ, q/Q=HA, r/R=ZD, s/S=HX, t/T=AD, u/U=XX, v/V=HH, w/W=ZX, x/X=XZ, y/Y=ZZ, z/Z=DX'. Black spaces are kept.
